value.title: How to create a Export to Excel / CSV button in Power BI

value.title: Get data with Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: How can you find, collect, and clean data from different sources? Power BI is a tool for making sense of your data. You will learn tricks to make data-gathering easier.

value.title: Create Buckets or Groups with Power Query in Power BI
value.excerpt: There are different ways you can create buckets or groups for your data in Power BI. Patrick shows you how this can be done with Power Query along with a few other options.  üì¢ Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership   *******************  Want to take your Power BI skills to the next level?

value.title: Power BI on a Mac?
value.excerpt: Want to run Power BI on a mac? We look at what your options are to get Power BI Desktop running on your mac. You have a few choices. value.title: Power BI Slicers vs Filters - which will you choose?
value.excerpt: Adam picks up on David Eldersveld's blog about Power BI slicers versus filters and looks at if slicers are even needed now. The filter pane can satisfy a majority of scenarios. There are a few that it can't. Which Power BI feature will you choose?  David Eldersveld blog - https://dataveld.com/2019/01/18/are-power-bi-slicers-still-relevant-with-the-new-filter-pane/

value.excerpt: There are different methods to use row-level security in Power BI; You can set up Row Level Security in Power BI itself or through a live connection from a data source such as SSAS Tabular. However, row-level security defined in the ways mentioned in the articles above isn‚Äôt dynamic. By dynamic row-level

value.title: Using the SELECTEDVALUE function in DAX
value.excerpt: Learn how the SELECTEDVALUE DAX function simplifies the syntax required in many scenarios where you need to read a single value selected in the filter context.  Article and download: https://sql.bi/53917?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt

value.title: Build Power BI visuals and reports
value.excerpt: visualize, data visualization

topItems.title: Scope report design requirements
topItems.excerpt: Gathering appropriate inputs to scope your report design requirements involves identifying your audience, determining the suitable report types, and defining their interface and experience requirements. This module provides you with a strong foundation on which to learn how to plan your report design requirements.

topItems.title: Design Power BI reports
topItems.excerpt: Because Power BI includes more than 30 core visuals, it can be challenging for a beginner to select the correct visual. This module will guide you through selecting the most appropriate visual type to meet your design and report layout requirements.

topItems.title: Configure Power BI report filters
topItems.excerpt: Report filtering is a complex topic because many techniques are available for filtering a Microsoft Power BI report. However, with complexity comes control, allowing you to design reports that meet requirements and expectations.

topItems.title: Enhance Power BI report designs for the user experience
topItems.excerpt: Enhance Power BI report designs for the user experience

value.title: Design effective reports in Power BI
value.excerpt: This learning path introduces a design process to design and deliver compelling Power BI reports. It begins by describing a proven design process created by leading report design experts. The process encompasses phases to understand the report users and their requirements, explore pleasing report designs, and develop reports all the way into production.

topItems.title: Scope report design requirements
topItems.excerpt: Gathering appropriate inputs to scope your report design requirements involves identifying your audience, determining the suitable report types, and defining their interface and experience requirements. topItems.excerpt: Because Power BI includes more than 30 core visuals, it can be challenging for a beginner to select the correct visual. This module will guide you through selecting the most appropriate visual type to meet your design and report layout requirements.

topItems.title: Configure Power BI report filters
topItems.excerpt: Report filtering is a complex topic because many techniques are available for filtering a Microsoft Power BI report. However, with complexity comes control, allowing you to design reports that meet requirements and expectations.
